Posts.Content: ccarter48818 wrote: Wow; what a kick in the gut.  I had my CT/PET results faxed to me yesterday.  Terrible bone progression including more mets in my left femur, including muscle, sternum, left hip, more spine involvement, chest lymph nodes and 5 lung mets.  I am devastated.  My last PET was Feb. 07 and it was near complete resolution of all mets.  I can't believe how it has spread like a wild fire.  We called yesterday and they moved my oncologist appt. to this afternoon; thankfully.  I've never had chemo, only radiation,femara, & aromasin.  Obviously the Femara I'm back on isn't helping at all.  I know I can no longer avoid chemo, I am completely ignorant of chemo and terrified of it. I've been dealing with BC since March of 06, I am 48 now, when I was diagnosed at stage 4 with extensive bone mets.  I have dealt with it all this time with the little hope that bone mets weren't so terrible, but now lung mets?  I'm shaking in my shoes.   Will post back after the appointment for your opinions on my doctor's choice of treatment.  I am so grateful to have all of you here. Carla Crystal, MI  Dx 3/3/2006, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: CT/PET So Much Progression ccarter48818 ccarter48818

Posts.Content: ccarter48818 wrote: Well, had my PET/CT report faxed to me yesterday.  Hard to believe I was NED on my April scan.  Extensive bone mets are active along with some new ones.  Most worrisome, lots of small liver mets in both lobes; have never had liver mets in 3 1/2 years.  I've been NED 3 times before this and every time the cancer comes roaring back so aggressively in a very short time.  I am becoming suspicious that I may be Her2Neu + instead of negative.  Gotta say I'm really scared (like we all aren't anyway) since there are lots of mets on my liver; not just a few here and there.   Course, haven't heard from my doctor.  I'm sure he doesn't know I signed the release to get my report before he could tell me what was on it.  The report said right on it that my doctor was immediately notified because of the significant findings.   Not sure what to expect next, but I need to be back on chemo yesterday.  I have a call into the University of Michigan Cancer Center.  I like my doctor, but he is way over extended and a general oncologist who is not up on the latest research for breast cancer.  I'm afraid I can't wait on him anymore.   Not sure what anyone else had for symptoms of liver mets but I've had nausea/some vomitting overall fatigue and noticed a tenderness under my right rib.  I thought I was feeling my gall bladder and it probably is because the report also says my gall bladder is extended.  Would assume that is because my liver is somewhat swollen.   What a damn nightmare this disease is. Hugs, Carla Crystal, MI 48 years old stage IV from the beginning with extensive bone mets; now liver mets Dx 3/3/2006, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Title: Crap Liver Mets ccarter48818 sportsmom

Posts.Content: ccarter48818 wrote: I just got a letter in the mail informing me that I have 3 months of jury duty starting with the December 5th 2008 term of Court.   I'm not well enough to do what I need to do for myself or my family; nor do I intend to spend what little energy I have running to a court room or sitting through a trial.   Someone please tell me how to take of this. Hugs, Carla Crystal, MI Dx 3/3/2006, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Jury Duty? Are they kidding me?! ccarter48818 Skyrat

Posts.Content: ccarter48818 wrote: I am at the end of the rope emotionally.  I started getting depressed last July after a bad hospital stay, but now I'm severely, sick depressed.  I can't do anything and cry almost constantly.  I've lost all my hope even though my cancer with liver mets is under control, all I can think of in this depressed state is "what's the point, it's just going to get me eventually anyway."  I've been dealing with mets from the get go more than 3 1/2 years ago and I was never in this emotional mess before.  I have a psychiatrist who weaned me off Zoloft and put me back on Effexor which I was taking before I was depressed.  So I was put on Zoloft which wasn't working and put back on Effexor which wasn't working; so I don't understand that at all.  Two weeks on 75mg Effexor twice a day and I'm not any better.  I'd kill myself, but I'm afraid to do that too; plus I know I don't really want to die, I just don't want this unbearable pain.  I have a great husband and 4 wonderful sons and I don't want to cause them all the pain that my depression in causing. The psychiatrist said I could be hospitalized, but I don't know what good that would do.  What can they do for me there besides making sure I don't hurt myself. Has anyone here come back from severe depression; I'm desperate for help? Hugs, Carla Dx 3/3/2006, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 4/4 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Clinical Depression ccarter48818 konakat
